metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12397 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A WebExtension can request access to local files without the warning prompt stating that the extension will "Access your data for all websites" being displayed to the user. This allows extensions to run content scripts in local pages without permission warnings when a local file is opened. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 60.3 and Firefox < 63.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12397` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
